alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 25 at 5:41PM MST until June 25 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR YAVAPAI COUNTY... At 538 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain has ended in southeast Yavapai County along Tangle Creek and the Verde River. However, between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen over portions of these drainages, and flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Horseshoe Reservoir. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Horse Creek, Squaw Creek, Professor Creek, Sycamore Creek, Dry Creek, Tangle Creek, Bishop Creek, Lime Creek, South Fork Mud Spring Creek, Ash Spring Creek, Mud Spring Creek, South Prong Sycamore Creek, Verde River, Davenport Wash, Silver Creek, Pigeon Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
